intro: Koeleria pallida, commonly known as the palekoeleria, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of North America. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and typically grows in dry, rocky soils. The plant produces small, pale blue or white flowers that bloom in early summer. Koeleria pallida is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit and is often found in open habitats such as prairies and sandy plains. It is adapted to survive in low-nutrient environments and is drought-tolerant.
